Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the implications of the proposed legislation, stating that "all Americans will be microchipped" when in reality the bill is focused on locating missing Alzheimer’s patients and autistic children.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to back up its assertion that "all Americans will be microchipped."
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the proposed legislation would result in mandatory microchipping of all Americans, which is not supported by the actual bill.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to consider alternative explanations for the proposed legislation, such as its focus on locating missing individuals rather than widespread microchipping.
